basic_info.name: Arulmurugan College of Engineering Admissions
description: For the UG program, candidates are selected on the basis of merit and the marks scored in 10+2 examinations. Candidates need to take part in TNEA counselling for entry. Admission to Post Graduate programs is granted based on merit.

basic_info.name: Arulmurugan College of Engineering Placements
description: Arulmurugan College of Engineering has a very active placement cell that serves as a base for many careers by directing students through regular counselling and campus recruitment arrangements in the right direction. This center maintains a meticulous database and supports students through campus recruitment to be put in national & international businesses.

Some of the top recruiters include IBM, HCL, HP, Nokia Siemens Networks, Tata Steel, Wipro, Avalon, Suxlon, Reliance, Atlas International, Hero Motocorp, B-TEX, TVS, Lintech Electric, Hyundai, LMW, Mphasis, etc.
Read More: Arulmurugan College of Engineering Placement

Section.name: About ACE
Section.description:
Arulmurugan College of Engineering, located in Karur, Tamil Nadu, was established in 2012. The college offers BE courses in 5 specializations and ME courses are 2 specializations at the postgraduate level. Admissions to all courses will be based on the performance of the candidate in various entrance exams like TNEA and TANCET followed by the counselling organized by the community.
The institution has witnessed impressive achievements in the field of Academic and Placement within 4 years, which are described below:
The following courses at UG and PG level are offered by Arulmurugan College of Engineering:
Read More: Arulmurugan College of Engineering Fees
For the UG program, candidates are selected on the basis of merit and the marks scored in 10+2 examinations. Candidates need to take part in TNEA counselling for entry. Admission to Post Graduate programs is granted based on merit.
Arulmurugan College of Engineering has a very active placement cell that serves as a base for many careers by directing students through regular counselling and campus recruitment arrangements in the right direction. This center maintains a meticulous database and supports students through campus recruitment to be put in national & international businesses.
Some of the top recruiters include IBM, HCL, HP, Nokia Siemens Networks, Tata Steel, Wipro, Avalon, Suxlon, Reliance, Atlas International, Hero Motocorp, B-TEX, TVS, Lintech Electric, Hyundai, LMW, Mphasis, etc.
Read More: Arulmurugan College of Engineering Placement
Read More: Arulmurugan College of Engineering Reviews

Ques. How does the placement cell in the Arulmurugan College of Engineering work?
Ans. The Cell for Training & Placement is dedicated to providing its graduates with all necessary assistance in their efforts to find jobs. In order to promote contacts between businesses and graduates, the Training & Placement service operates all year around.

Ques. What are the fees of BE at Arulmurugan College of Engineering?
Ans. The BE fee is INR INR 60000 per year at Arulmurugan College of Engineering.
Ques. What is the intake criteria in Arulmurugan College of Engineering?
Ans. 65% seats (GQ) are admitted through Tamilnadu Engineering Admissions (TNEA) by single window admissions and the rest by the Management Quota (MQ) based on common ranking provided by the Consortium of Engineering colleges approved by the Govt.

Duration: 4 years
			Specializations: Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electronics and Communication Engineering, Computer Science and Engineering, Electrical and Electronics Engineering.
			Eligibility: A pass in 10+2 with 50% (OC), 45% (BC), and 40% (MBC, DNC, SC, SCA, ST) avg. marks scored in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry combined.
			Selection Criteria: Entrance Based (TNEA)

faqs.question: What are the Civil Engineering program outcomes at Arulmurugan College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: Ans.Following are the civil engineering program outcome:An ability to apply knowledge of mathematics, science, and engineering and to design and conduct experiments, as well as to analyze and interpret data.An ability to design a system, component, or process to meet desired needs within realistic constraints such as economic, environmental, social, political, ethical, health and safety, and sustainability and to function on multi-disciplinary teams.An ability to identify, formulate and solve engineering problems and to understand the impact of engineering solutions in a global and societal context.

faqs.question: How does the placement cell in the Arulmurugan College of Engineering work?
faqs.answer: Ans.The Cell for Training & Placement is dedicated to providing its graduates with all necessary assistance in their efforts to find jobs. In order to promote contacts between businesses and graduates, the Training & Placement service operates all year around.

faqs.question: What are the lab facilities available in the Mechanical engineering department at Arulmurugan College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: Ans.Following labs are available in Mechanical Department:ADM/ CAMD/ CAM/ Simulation and Analysis LabHeat Power LabThermal Engineering LabKinematics and Dynamic LabsManufacturing Technology

faqs.question: What are the fees of BE at Arulmurugan College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: Ans.The BE fee is INR INR 60000 per year at Arulmurugan College of Engineering.

faqs.question: What is the intake criteria in Arulmurugan College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: Ans.65% seats (GQ) are admitted through Tamilnadu Engineering Admissions (TNEA) by single window admissions and the rest by the Management Quota (MQ) based on common ranking provided by the Consortium of Engineering colleges approved by the Govt.
